#Text=Find Horse Related Jobs
#Text=If you have a passion for horses and a desire to work with them in some capacity , then you will undoubtedly need to look for work in the equestrian field .
#Text=Ideally , you should decide what kind of work you would like to pursue .
#Text=But whether it is as a horse trainer , breaker , or groomer , the steps needed to find horse related jobs are the same .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Search online for equine employment listings .
#Text=In the age of the Internet you can research horse related opportunities near and far .
#Text=The Internet provides a wealth of information , including numerous job-searching websites .
#Text=Many of these sites allow you to register with them , and in return they will send you emails of job openings as they become available .
#Text=Make a list of barns , and look them up online when researching equestrian jobs .
#Text=If these locations are looking for help , they will usually include that information on their website .
#Text=Subscribe to equestrian magazines and review their advertisements .
#Text=Oftentimes , industry publications offer a classified section that includes job opportunities .
#Text=If not , you can still research names of horse barns online .
#Text=Use your contacts to your advantage in your horse related job search .
#Text=If you know someone in the horse industry , a trainer or barn owner , or if you know someone who knows someone , do n't be afraid to use that association to put in a good word for yourself .
#Text=Mention your interest in the equestrian field and that you are looking for work in that industry , even if it 's just to get a foot in the door .
#Text=These contacts would be great informational resources too .
#Text=Pick their brains and find out the best way to break into the business .
#Text=Contact barn owners directly , even if you do n't know them .
#Text=Make a call or drop in for a visit .
#Text=Explain your interest in working with horses and how much experience you have , if any .
#Text=Be honest and down to earth , and if you have a true passion for horses the barn owner will recognize it .
#Text=If there are no jobs currently available , request a referral to another barn that may be interested , or leave your contact information and ask that you be contacted should anything open up .
#Text=Get the word out about your interest in jobs with horses by posting fliers in industry related retail locations , such as tack and feed stores .
#Text=These locations often provide a message board for such advertisements .
#Text=You can also leave a flyer with barn owners that you drop in to visit .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Consider an intern position to get your foot in the door .
#Text=Sometimes it 's best not to be too picky about what you apply for in the equestrian field .
#Text=If this is something that you are passionate about , you may want to consider taking what you can get , including an internship as a horse groomer or handyman .
#Text=It may not be your ultimate goal of becoming a horse trainer , but it may get you there eventually .
#Text=And in the mean time you can build your resume with valuable knowledge and allow your employer to see what you are truly capable of .
